article.Body:
Moneycontrol Bureau

The government is all set to present its Budget for 2017 at 11 AM today. This Budget will be watched closely as it is the first one after the government’s demonetisation move that was implemented in November 2016.

With demonetisation casting a shadow over the Budget, everyone – from the common man to corporates – are expecting relief in some form.

Moneycontrol has come up with some videos that explain what goes into making of a Budget. From the government’s expenditure agenda on infrastructure like roads and subsidies to the parliamentary approval for it has been explained.

The crucial figure to watch out for would be the fiscal deficit figure, which measures the government’s annual borrowing. The video also explains the key terms that form the Budget speech.

Once the Finance Minister announces the Budget, it is tabled in the Parliament and then the discussions and voting happens over it.
